decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The event is permitted between 19 July 2018 to 7 September 2018 inclusive of site construction and demolition

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (  L001 Location Map Rev A, L021 Fence Elevation Rev A, L020 Site ISO Rev A, L013 Waste Location Rev A, L011 Car Park Location Rev A, L010 Fire Equipment Rev A, L022 Location - Access Rev A, L018 Temporary Structures Rev A, L017 Bar Locations Rev A, L016 CCTV Locations Rev A, L019 Site Elevations Rev A, L005 Fire Routes Rev A, 
Flood Risk Assessment, Access Statement, Community Engagement/Benefits Statement, Draft Noise Management Protocol, Noise Management Plan, Transport Assessment - Build, Dismantle and Servicing, Design and Access Statement, Drainage Form, Ancillary Equipment Document, Environmental Statement, Set Layout, Transport Assessment - Venue Operations.
Received 2nd March 2018) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - Prior to the start of the shows, an updated Events Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The Events Management Plan shall include:
- details of how the crowds will be managed while leaving the event to ensure staggered movement of people, 
- how people will be encouraged to use both sides of the pavement on the approach to Acton Town. 
- details of how the details of the management plan, details of the 'issues reporting' line and event starting times will be shared with local residents and relevant ward members.
The event shall be managed in accordance with the details approved in this plan.

Condition : 4 - Prior to the commencement of the development an updated Build, Dismantle and Servicing Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The revised plan shall include details of the construction and servicing vehicle movements collaborated with the movements required over the time period for the wider side construction methods. The proposal shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.
Condition : 5 - Prior to the commencement of the use, the proposed cycle storage shall be installed and available for use. The spaces shall be available throughout the duration of the event.

Condition : 6 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 08:00 - 18:00  Monday - Friday and 08:00-13:00 Saturday and no work on a Sunday or Public Holiday, save for the construction and deconstruction periods of the site (scheduled for 19/07/18 to 24/07/18 and 03/09/18 to 07/09/18 and subject to alteration by agreement) when construction and demolition can take place between 08:00 to 20:00 Monday to Sunday.  During the construction and deconstruction period, noisy works (defined as works which can be heard outside the boundary of the park) shall only take place between 08:00 to 18:00 on Mondays to Sunday. 
Notification of on-site Construction Manager contact details to be provided to Local Authority Enforcement Team prior to occupation of the site.

Condition : 7 - Prior to the commencement of the use a Delivery and Servicing Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority for each building that is part of that phase. The Plan shall require details on vehicles would deliver to the site. The measures approved in the Plan shall be implemented and maintained permanently maintained.

Condition : 8 - The floodlighting hereby approved shall only be operational 0800-23.30 and turned off at all other times, except for that required for security and safety purposes.  Floodlighting will take into consideration the location of and proximity to local residential premises.
Condition : 9 - The uses and structures hereby approved shall only be operational 11:00-23:30 for the duration of the permission.

Condition : 10 - (a)	Prior to any on site works commencing, a photo record and site conditions report and a remediation strategy (which demonstrates how the site will be returned to its pre-event state as a minimum) undertaken by qualified agronomist shall be submitted to the Council
(b)	Following the conclusion of the events hereby approved, the applicant shall complete the necessary remediation to return the land  to the condition identified in part (a) of this condition (save for any wear and tear as identified in the lease agreement).
(c)	Evidence of the site restoration as outlined in part (b) of this condition shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority within 1 month of the removal of the structures hereby approved.

Condition : 11 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the protocol outlined in the Noise Management Protocol, or such other protocol as agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.
description: Temporary use of the space for a series of special event film screenings which are due to take place each Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday for a period from Thursday August 2nd until Sunday September 2nd. In addition there will be Tuesday a Community Screening (for local residents only) - to take place between 1600 - 2300 on August 14th and an additional public performance on Monday August 27th - Bank Holiday Monday - 1500 - 2300. Weekend events will take place between 1500 and 2300. The site will include a number of temporary structures to house event venues, catering establishments, bars and activties as well as a number of set pieces and a large film screen. In the non-public areas there will be a number of temporary buildings (offices, dressing rooms, storage etc) as well as infrastructure and facilities to include water, power, waste and HVAC equipment as required
